entry.title: Re: How to connect SAP Planon with S4HANA Public cloud wi...
entry.content:
Hello @Chuma  ,

First of all I want to say thankyou so much for your quick response on every post.

Can you share the proper, step-by-step instructions—ideally with snapshots—that we can follow to properly integrate everything?

  • From the SAP BTP side:

    • What exactly needs to be done?

    • Which applications or services must be subscribed to?

    • Do I need a new sub‑account?

    • What about service keys and service bindings—what are they for?

  • From the SAP Planon side (since Planon is new to us):

    • What exactly needs to be done?

    • Please include steps along with snapshots.

  • From the S/4HANA side:

    • What do I need to configure?

    • Which communication user, communication system, and communication arrangement do I need to create?

    • For the communication system, what values go in the Host entries (endpoint-side settings)?

    • What should I use for inbound and outbound users?

    • In the communication arrangement, what details must be added?

I want these steps to be easy to follow so the integration works smoothly.

Thanks in advance.
Ahmed

entry.title: Re: Creating a URL to connect a dashboard to an Order in...
entry.content:
Hello @Lyzmarcadus 

Yes, it is possible to create a direct link from your dashboard to a specific order in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This allows users to access and edit the order immediately, without the need to manually copy and paste the order number.

To implement this, you can create a deep link that directly points to the specific order in the SAP Fiori launchpad. Users simply click the link from your dashboard and are taken straight to the order, as long as they have the necessary access rights.

For comprehensive guidance on deep linking and app integration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, please consult the official SAP documentation here:
Manual Integration of Apps and Deep Linking in SAP Build Work Zone
https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-advanced-edition/sap-build-work-zone-advanced-edition/manual-integration-of-apps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Request for Solution – Assigning Assets to Employees...
entry.content:
Hello @ahsanali 

There is no standard Personnel Number field to assign assets directly to employees in the asset master in S4HANA Public Cloud, as seen in your screenshot. This limitation results from the simplified standard design of the Public Cloud.

To monitor asset assignments to employees, you can utilise custom fields via the SAP Fiori  Custom Fields and Logic  app or consider developing extensions on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) for more advanced scenarios.

For more information on custom fields and enhancements, please consult the official SAP documentation.
Custom Fields and Logic in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-s4hcloud-procurement-po-customlogic-tracing..html

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F1481')/S35

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Unable to see the Joule entitlement in BTP
entry.content: Can individual get Joule Embedded SKU without any organization details or tax information?

entry.title: Re: How to Perform Multiple Asset Retirements in S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hello @SivaNagiReddy 

The Post Asset Retirement app only supports single-asset postings. A genuine mass retirement option is not provided in the standard.

For multiple assets, you have two supported approaches:

API-based: Utilise the Fixed Asset Post Asset Retirement API from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Each retirement is recorded asset by asset, but you can automate bulk processing by looping through multiple assets in middleware or custom integration.

No-code automation: Use SAP Build Process Automation to coordinate retirements without coding. BPA can activate the API or help automate the Post Asset Retirement app for multiple assets in a seamless way.

There is no direct “mass retirement” app, but you can achieve the requirement with API automation or BPA.

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to Track Approval Details of Maintenance Requests
entry.content:
Hello @kaya-ya 

The Screen Maintenance Requests app does not display approval history. To monitor who approved or rejected a request, use the following.

  • My Inbox – shows approvals, rejections, and next approvers.
  • Manage Workflow Instances – full workflow log with timestamps and decisions.

SAP Help – Manage Workflow Instances

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to track the person responsible or custodian of t...
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, there isn’t a standard Personnel Number field in the asset master, as there is in Private Cloud.

To track the employee responsible, such as a laptop assigned to an individual, the recommended approach is to add a custom custodian/employee field to the asset master using the Custom Fields and Logic app.

This field can then be utilised in apps and reports, and if you use SuccessFactors, it can be linked to employee master data.

Withn regards

Chums

entry.title: Enhancing Security in Identity Authentication Service (IAS) with Certificate-Based Authentication
entry.content:
🔐Enhancing Security in Identity Authentication Service (IAS) with Certificate-Based Authentication

✨“Moving beyond Client ID & Secret — strengthening IAS with certificate-based authentication for enterprise-grade security.”

About Me

Hare Krishna 🙏 I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect, sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

📘Introduction

In modern enterprise landscapes, Identity Authentication Service (IAS) plays a key role in securing access to applications and systems. Traditionally, system user authentication in IAS relied on Client ID and Secret (essentially a username and password mechanism). While simple to implement, it comes with inherent risks—🔑 password leakage and 🗄️ storage vulnerabilities.

To address these challenges, IAS provides the option to use certificate-based authentication, offering a stronger and more secure alternative.

 

 

 

 

 

 

⚠️Limitations of Client ID & Secret Authentication

Although widely used, Client ID and Secret authentication has drawbacks:

  • 🔑Password-like storage: Secrets need to be securely stored, often in encrypted vaults.

  • 🚨Leakage risk: Exposure in logs, code repositories, or integrations can compromise the system.

🛡️ Why Certificate-Based Authentication?

Certificate-based authentication strengthens IAS security by replacing secrets with a cryptographic key pair.

  • 🔒Stronger Security: Asymmetric encryption makes brute-force attacks impractical.

  • 🗝️ No password dependency: Eliminates risks tied to weak or reused passwords.

  • 🛑Leakage-resistant: Public certificate exposure is harmless without the private key.

⚙️How It Works in IAS

  1. 👤System User Creation: Generate a certificate instead of a Client ID and Secret.

  2. 🔑Public-Private Key Pair:

    • The public certificate is uploaded to IAS.

    • The private key remains with the consuming application.

  3. 🔍Authentication: IAS validates the presented certificate.

  4. ✅Access Granted: Secure communication is established.

🔗Real-World Use Cases for Certificate-Based Authentication

So when should you consider using certificate-based authentication in IAS?

This approach is particularly beneficial when:

  • 🌐You need to establish API-based connectivity with IAS from external tools or applications.

  • 🔧A system user is required for integrations, automations, or monitoring purposes.

  • 🛡️ You want to secure machine-to-machine (M2M) communication more efficiently than with Client ID & Secret.

In such scenarios, certificates ensure stronger trust and reduce credential management risks, making them ideal for enterprise-grade integrations.

🖼️ Real-Life Example: Configuring Certificate-Based Authentication in IAS

📂Understanding Certificate Formats Before You Begin

Before we jump into the actual configuration, it’s important to understand the different certificate file formats you may encounter during the process. This helps avoid confusion when handling files like .p12, .crt, and .pem.

✅Key Differences at a Glance

Format Contains Private Key? Contains Cert(s)? Encoding Typical Use
.crt❌No✅YesBase64 (PEM) or Binary (DER)Server certificate file
.pem✅Optional✅YesBase64 (PEM)Flexible container for certs/keys
.p12 / .pfx✅Yes✅Yes (can include full chain)Binary (PKCS#12)Import/export in apps, keystores

🔑Practical Flow in IAS Scenario

  • You generate a .p12 (PKCS#12) file → this includes both your private key and certificate chain.

  • From this .p12, you typically extract:

    • Private Key → required for secure client authentication.

    • Full Certificate Chain (.crt/.pem) → ensures trust and proper verification.

👉By understanding this, you’ll know what each file is for and why it’s being used in SAP IAS certificate-based authentication.

Step by Step instructions to perform the activity

Generate .p12 → extract private key (.pem) → extract full certificate chain (.crt/.pem) → upload public cert/chain to IAS (system user) → store private key securely in your app → enable client-certificate auth → test the API connectivity.

Login to IAS, Click on Administrators and create System User with required privileges

Click on Certificate

Provide CN name and password for certificate and click on generate - it will create a .p12 file

Save it.

Open Terminal and enter command (here API_Cert.p12 is the certificate name downloaded from IAS). Post this enter the required fields like passphrase etc.

openssl pkcs12 -in API_Cert.p12 -info

It will have private key and Full chain certificate, Copy the Private key in a text file and save it as .pem file

similarly copy the full chain certificate in a text file and save it as .pem

Upload the full chain certificate in IAS and save it.

Certificate is successfully uploaded in IAS

Let's test it using POSTMAN. Open Postman and go to settings -> Add certificate -> upload the certificate as shown below and provide URL of IAS and password

Perform a get operation to check if connectivity is working fine. You should receive 200 success message like shown below

📝Best Practices for Certificate-Based Authentication in IAS

  • 📆Track certificate validity: Default validity is 1 year — plan renewals in advance.

  • 🗄️ Secure private keys: Store them in HSMs or trusted key vaults.

  • 🔄Automate renewal: Prevent downtime due to expired certificates.

  • 📊Monitor usage: Continuously audit authentication logs in IAS.

🎯Conclusion

Switching from Client ID & Secret to certificate-based authentication in IAS is a major security enhancement. It reduces password-related risks, strengthens trust between systems, and ensures compliance.

By adopting certificates, enterprises can align IAS with modern security standards, making their environment more secure, resilient, and future-ready 🚀.

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Product Compliance - Colla...
entry.content:
Hello @jan_morskate 

Currently, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition does not support the Campaign feature used in Private Cloud for gathering compliance information from suppliers. Public Cloud provides strong product compliance tools, such as SDS and dangerous goods management, but campaigns are not supported.

You can achieve a similar result by using SAP Business Network to include compliance questionnaires in procurement, or by creating a custom BTP-based campaign app that emails suppliers and inputs responses into S/4. Let me know if you'd like assistance in designing one.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: S/4 Public cloud - Service - repair in house subcontr...
entry.content:
Hello @Laure_AD 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, subcontracting is not part of the in-house repair process. The repair is managed with scope item 3XK In-House Repair, while any external work is handled through Service Procurement with a Service Entry Sheet.

If you want to keep track of logistics, outbound and inbound deliveries are available for sending and receiving the customer’s equipment.

SAP Documentation  SAP Learning -In-House Repair (3XK)  and Purchase Requisitions for Purchaser

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Function Module Product_List_Exclusion does not consider only Listing
entry.content:
Hi All

We have a requirement to check if there are any records in a listing procedure for a Sales Org / Customer. We were trying to use the SAP function Module PRODUCT_LIST_EXCLUSION. We used the FM and passed the parameters in the Header structure with no details in the Item. We also passed the Listing procedure in the field for SCHEME. However, the FM does not read the Listing procedure and does not provide a feedback that record exists. We verified that there are records in listing condition type in the listing procedure specified in the FM but we do not get the required result.

Any expert inputs on the use of the FM ? 

Appreciate your help

Regards

Rohit Zalani

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to integrate Power BI with S/4HANA Clo...
entry.content:
Hi,

 

For a customer, we were able to connect SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud (RISE with SAP) to Power BI using ODBC connectors.

We raised a service request to SAP & asked them to install ODBC drivers for SAP Database & create a user that can be used while connecting to Power BI in the logon screen as seen in the below URL. 

Refer below blog for more details.

Power Query SAP HANA database connector - Power Query | Microsoft Learn

 

Since there are a lot of licensing changes happening in SAP Private Cloud, you can check with SAP team if there is any new license to be procured for connectors.


Regards,

Gavin.

We raised a service request to SAP & asked them to install ODBC drivers for SAP HANA Database & asked them to create a user that can be used while connecting to Power BI in the logon screen as seen in the below URL. 

Refer below blog for more details.

Power Query SAP HANA database connector - Power Query | Microsoft Learn

 

Since there are a lot of licensing changes happening in SAP Private Cloud, you can check with SAP team if there is any new license to be procured for connectors.


Regards,

Gavin.

entry.title: IPアドレス変更時のRFC宛先設定変更について
entry.content:
Solmanサーバ、ERPサーバ、SAPRouterサーバについてIPアドレスが変更となり、
後述のRFC宛先についてIPアドレスが設定されているため、トランザクションコードSM59で変更しようとしております。
それぞれ括弧内に記載したユーザ（「Logonとセキュリティ」タブに登録されているユーザ）のパスワード欄に何を入力すればよいのか教えていただけませんでしょうか。
具体的な値や確認方法、もしくは作成し直す場合はその手順を教えていただきたく、よろしくお願い致します。

RFCs for SAP communication: SAP-OSS, SAP-OSS-LIST-O01


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: IPアドレス変更時のRFC宛先設定変更について
entry.content:
2020/5/29から、RFCの接続（SAPOSSやSDCC_OSS）よりSAPバックエンドと通信できないことなりました。
直接にSAPへデータ送信するために、Checklistsのステップに従い、HTTPSの宛先を利用する必要がございます。技術通信ユーザの登録も必要でございます。

詳細情報につきまして、以下をご参照ください。
2923799 - Final Shutdown of RFC Connections From Customer Systems to SAP
2740667 - SAP is going to close its proprietary RFC communication for automated data exchange between Customers & SAP Support Backbone (SAPOSS) by July 2020
--------------------------------
If you still have systems connecting to SAP Support backbone using RFC channels, you must now migrate to SAP’s new HTTPS-based Support Backbone infrastructure
by following the instructions provided in our Support Backbone Guide and Checklists without further delay.
-----------------------------------

entry.title: Clarification on Project Validation BAdI (Enterprise Project) – Feasibility of External API Call
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are currently testing part of a customer requirement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. The ultimate goal of this implementation is to trigger an API call to an external system in order to provide notifications whenever an Enterprise Project is created or released.

Since this request comes from a potential customer evaluation, a clear answer is critical and time-sensitive. We would therefore highly appreciate your guidance at the earliest possible time.

For this purpose, we are analyzing the Business Add-In (BAdI) in the Project Structure (PPM-SCL-STR) component, specifically the Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI. Reference: Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI. During our evaluation, we identified three main points for clarification:

1. BAdI Release Status for Developer Extensibility

  • The Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI is currently released only for Key User Extensibility and is not released for Developer Extensibility.

  • We would like to confirm whether it is possible to request SAP to release this BAdI for Developer Extensibility as well.

  • From our understanding, such requests must be submitted through the SAP Customer Influence program, but this does not guarantee approval and the process may take significant time. Could you please confirm whether there are any other alternatives available in the meantime?

2. Feasibility of External POST Call from Custom Logic

  • If enabling Developer Extensibility is not feasible in the short term, we would like to know whether it is technically possible to perform an HTTP POST call directly from the Custom Logic implementation of this BAdI.

  • We have already created the Communication Scenario and Outbound Service in ADT, and the Communication System and Communication Arrangement in the tenant are configured correctly.

  • Our main question is whether outbound communication is permitted from Custom Logic, and if so, we kindly request sample code or reference documentation to validate the approach.

3. Reference Case – Purchase Requisition BAdI

As a reference, we reviewed the Check of Purchase Requisition Item BAdI, which is released for both Key User Extensibility and Developer Extensibility. Reference: Check of Purchase Requisition Item BAdI.

  • In this case, it seems possible to implement outbound API calls using ADT with Developer Extensibility. Could you please confirm whether our assumption is correct?

  • Additionally, once the Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI is released for Developer Extensibility, would a similar outbound communication approach be feasible?


SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ABAP Extensibility

entry.title: How to Disable Status "preliminary import requested" from CHARM Change Document status RoadMap
entry.content:
Hi Team, 

We would like to disable few Change document statuses from CHARM Roadmap.

Thanks,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to Disable Status "preliminary import requested"...
entry.content:
Hi,

Regarding your requirement, in standard SMMJ, step 5,6,7,8 are bound together for preliminary import scenario, see below document for more details:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_Solution_Manager/8b923a2175be4939816f0981b73856c7/d6e6bcc740964311987d440ab83e6684.html

If you don't want to see step 5,6,7, but just leave step8, we don't have that in standard, you need to involve consulting service to help further.

But if you want to remove the whole step 5,6,7,8, then you could follow below KBAs to do the reverse. But we don't recommend to do that from our side:

KBA: 0002500852 - ChaRM Customizing: Inserting New User Status

KBA: 0003103731 - How to work with Action Definition and Action Conditions

Once you remove all the definitions(user statuses, actions/conditions) of preliminary import(step 5,6,7,8), you will not see step 5,6,7,8 in the status overview.

Hope these clarify and help.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: SAP HANA -License Expired soon -request for new, how...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

In order to request a new license key for your new hardware key, could you pls kindly refer to the detailed steps mentioned in KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/2663013 and request the new key in the License Keys app?

Pls then download the new key and install the new key in Slicense. But pls make sure to delete ALL the old/expired license key records from Slicense before installing the new key.

Hope the above information helps.

Thanks and regards,
SAP Support

If not, you can add the required fields to PROJ table via SE11 and make it workable, use EXIT_SAPLCJWB_002 and EXIT_SAPLCJWB_003

entry.title: Re: Function Module Product_List_Exclusion does not consi...
entry.content: Even if valid condition records exist in the listing procedure, the FM may not return results unless specific material data is passed in the item structure. What you can try is include at least one material number (MATNR) that you want to check. Also, include the relevant sales org, distribution channel, and customer in the header. Ensure the scheme matches the one configured in your condition records.

entry.title: Re: Mexico DIOT report issue in Public Cloud Fiori

Hi everyone, I got the response from SAP.

Hello Customer,

SAP will delivery those adjustments to your system (Including the business types) in a future release.

As for now, it's not possible to insert it manually on the system. Development team is currently working on this delivery, but currently we don't have an estimated date.
As a workaround, please adjust the Business Type (and other new necessary entries) manually on the txt result from the current layout (20 positions).

entry.title: Re: KP26 create but info not update in COST
entry.content:
Ensure the activity type has a valid cost element assigned in KL01/KL02. The cost element should be of category 43 (internal activity allocation).
KP26 uses planning version (typically version 0). Check that the fiscal year and periods match your planning horizon.
Even after changes, old control records in tables like CSSL may interfere. Not sure, in which version you are working but you can check SAP Note 129584 for more information. May be you can run the report RKPLNC29 to clean up residual planning data.

entry.title: Re: Production Order Split
entry.content:
Hi ND,

Base on your requirement you can check the BAdIs on Production Operation (Execution and Control) area on Online Help: Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) for Key User Extensibility | SAP Help Portal.

For example, the split function is on production order operation level, you may check the BAdI: BD_COBADICFL_MFGORDER_OPR_INIT and BD_COBADICFL_MFGORDER_OPR.

entry.title: Re: Add Z Fields in 'User Data Tab' of tx. CJ01 / CJ02 /...
entry.content: Thank you. Actually, already 'User Data' tab is existing in CJ01 tx. in our systems, also the PROJ table has the associated fields in it (for example, USR00, USR01, USR02 etc.). Now, we need (1) Place the input field (2) Label it and (3) Process user specified data

entry.title: Re: Revoking of Withholding Tax Rounding Off Rule
entry.content:
Yes, you can revoke the rounding-off rule for Withholding Tax Type mid-year, but you need to take into considerations the below points:

  • SAP calculates WHT based on the rule active at the time of posting. Changing the rule does not retroactively adjust previously posted entries.
  • Entries posted before April 2024 used rounding (e.g., ₹100.55 → ₹101). Entries after revocation will reflect exact calculated amounts (e.g., ₹100.55 stays ₹100.55). This may lead to minor discrepancies in reporting, reconciliation, or audit trails.
  • Reports like FBL1N, FBL3N, or tax registers may show inconsistent WHT values across periods.
  • Reversing old entries and reposting them after rule change may result in different WHT amounts. This could affect vendor balances or tax liability calculations.

entry.title: Re: Python support in CAP based Application
entry.content:
While CAP has been designed for Node.js and Java, you can absolutely use Python on BTP.  All 3 runtimes: Cloud Foundry, Kyma and SAP AI core allow you to deploy python apps and they can integrate very well with your CAP applications at the API layer. And now of course you can make use of SAP Databricks to host ML workloads as well.

"AI experts" will typically use python notebooks for exploratory data analysis and building machine learning models and you can do this with the Business Application Studio.

You can use the python package hana-ml to make use of the machine learning capabilities built right into hana or whatever favourite ML frameworks (scikit-learn, pytorch, langchain, openai) you like and then serve them with an api endpoint in cloud foundry kyma or ai core to be used by your CAP app.

If you are thinking more about LLM's - you can already integrate them into your cap apps quite easily using APIs and the helper SDK's that SAP provides like https://sap.github.io/ai-sdk/, without needing python.

 

And now of course with the partnership with Databricks and SAP Business Data Cloud you can create your notebooks in Databricks as well for an out of the box feature set.

entry.title: Re: Add a new field in S/4 Material master and EWM produc...
entry.content:
Though it is possible the steps are many, involving both technical and functional.

Step 1: Add the New Field to Material Master in S/4HANA

1.1. Define the Field in the Data Dictionary

  • Go to SE11.
  • Create or enhance the structure:
    • For basic data: MARA
    • For plant-specific data: MARC
    • For storage location data: MAKT, etc.
  • Add your custom field (e.g., ZZFIELD_NAME) with appropriate data type.

1.2. Enhance the Screen Using Transaction CMOD

  • Use CMOD to enhance the material master screens.
  • Use the enhancement project: SAPLXMARA.
  • Implement the user exit: EXIT_SAPLMGMU_001 (for screen enhancements).
  • Add your field to the screen using a subscreen.

1.3. Update the Field in the Database

  • Implement logic in:
    • EXIT_SAPLMGMU_002 – for data transfer from screen to internal table.
    • EXIT_SAPLMGMU_003 – for data transfer from internal table to screen.

1.4. Maintain Field in Field Selection Group

  • Go to SPRO → Logistics General → Material Master → Field Selection → Assign Fields to Field Selection Groups.
  • Assign your new field to a group so it appears in the UI.

Step 2: Propagate the Field to EWM

2.1. Check Integration Method

  • If you're using CIF (Core Interface) or DRF (Data Replication Framework), you need to ensure the field is included in the replication model.

2.2. Extend the Structure for CIF/DRF

  • For CIF: Extend structure CIFMAT01 or relevant BAdI.
  • For DRF: Use transaction DRFOUT and extend the relevant data model (e.g., MATMAS).

2.3. Enhance the Mapping Logic

  • Use BAdIs like:
    • BADI_CIFMAT (for CIF)
    • BADI_DRF_OUTBOUND (for DRF)
  • Map your custom field from S/4 to the EWM structure.

2.4. Enhance EWM Side

  • In EWM (usually on a decentralized system), extend the material master structure.
  • Use transaction EEWB or SE11 to add the field.
  • Enhance the UI and logic to use the new field.

Step 3: Test the End-to-End Flow

  1. Create or change a material in S/4HANA.
  2. Ensure the new field is visible and editable.
  3. Trigger replication to EWM.
  4. Verify the field is received and stored correctly in EWM.

entry.title: Re: Add Z Fields in 'User Data Tab' of tx. CJ01 / CJ02 /...
entry.content:
To place the input fields, SAP already provides fields like USR00, USR01, etc. in the PROJ table for customer use.

To make them visible in the “User Data” tab, go to SPRO → Project System → Structures → Operative Structures → Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) → User Interface Settings → Create User-Defined Fields for WBS Elements. Assign the PROJ-USRxx fields to the screen layout. Choose the screen group and assign the fields to the “User Data” tab.

To label the fields, in the same SPRO path, you can assign labels to each USR field. These labels will appear as field descriptions in the UI. You can also use screen painter (SE51) if you want more control over layout and grouping.

Use the enhancement CJWB0001, which includes:

Inside these exits, map screen fields to PROJ-USRxx, Validate or transform input if needed. Ensure data is saved to the database correctly.

entry.title: Re: Issue with a simple FMS
entry.content: Hi Chris, This worked for me: Declare @Percnt numeric(18,6) =$[$38.U_Tariff.number] Declare @Rate numeric(18,6)=$[$38.14.number] SELECT convert(numeric(18,6),@Rate) * convert(numeric(18,6),(@Percnt/100)) Regards, Joseph

entry.title: Re: Possibilities and Limitations of GROW with SAP - Core...
entry.content:
Hi @Aratrika_Bardhan 

Thank you for your questions. Let me walk you through it.

Below are the Core Functionalities Provided by the Add-On

The basic HR administration and organizational management helps you manage personnel records, job information, organizational structures, and headcount. It provides some self-service for HR teams and employees. Which can include employee data updates, org changes. It also provides some guided business processes and simple workflows such as onboarding/offboarding or record changes. If integrated with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, you can leverage native connectivity for core ERP HR processes. However, there is limited reporting and analytics on HR data.

The Key Limitations compared to Full SuccessFactors EC

You do not get the full SuccessFactors Employee Central experience, such as advanced talent management, performance reviews, full employee lifecycle, goal, and compensation functions.

You will face fewer configuration and extension options compared to SuccessFactors EC. Add-ons and deep custom workflows may not be possible or are limited.

You do have some simplified set of employee and manager self-services which is limited compared to powerful EC features.

While integration to SAP S/4HANA Cloud and essentials like Payroll or Time Tracking are possible, please note that not all SuccessFactors native integrations or partner apps are available without EC.

Below are you Integration Possibilities

It has the possibility to connects with SAP S/4HANA modules such as core HR, Payroll, and Time Tracking within the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. It can also leverage standard APIs for basic data flows.

However, it lacks full SuccessFactors suite integration if EC license is absent. Therefore, making some workflows or analytics limited to a certain extent.

These are Customization and Extensibility possibilities you may consider:

You have the possibility to configure dropdowns, branding, basic business rules, and workflows.

Extensions for example fields or business logic can be added. However, it is important to note that complex workflow or process design is limited compared to EC.

That means it is best for standard HR scenarios and modest customizations and it is not suitable for full enterprise-wide HXM needed by complex organizations.

When Implementing here are considerations and Best Practices to consider:

First is to ensure you clarify your desired scope early enough and ensure client understands what is included and excluded.

Then assess your integration and reporting requirements. If you need deep analytics, workflow automation, or talent management, limitations may require changes to your approach.

In your integration process, you should expect some change management challenges, especially if you are transitioning from full EC or other legacy solutions.

 

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Introducing the GROW with SAP, core HR add-on

entry.title: Re: Origin acceptance fields is not selecting when we use...
entry.content: SAP does not default the "Acceptance at Origin" field based on Incoterms in standard configuration. This is because the field is optional and context-dependent. SAP assumes users will manually set it based on business rules. To automate this and avoid manual effort, you can implement a BAdI ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST

entry.title: SBPA Process Scheduler Trigger : A Step-by-Step Demo on Invoice Validation Approval
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

Welcome back to our SAP Build Process Automation series! In this third blog, we'll dive deep into one of the most crucial aspects of process automation: how to automatically start business processes using scheduler. 

What Are Scheduled Triggers?

Scheduled triggers enable you to automate the initiation of business processes at predefined intervals, eliminating the need for manual intervention or dependency on external events. By defining a time-based schedule, you can ensure that processes run exactly when you want them to, whether that’s daily, weekly, monthly, or following a custom recurrence pattern.

Key Benefits:

  • Hands-free automation – Processes start automatically without user action.
  • Enhanced efficiency – Streamlines operations by reducing delays and human error.
  • Lower manual workload – Frees up resources for higher-value activities.
  • Consistent execution – Ensures tasks run on time, every time.
  • Flexible scheduling – Supports a wide range of recurrence patterns to suit business needs.

Prerequisites

Before starting, ensure you have:

  1. Access to SAP Build Process Automation
  2. A working process (we'll use the vendor invoice validation approval process project from previous episodes)
  3. BTP Cockpit access for service key retrieval - trial cockpit

Step-by-Step Implementation 

Phase 1: Project Setup

Step 1: Create a Copy of Your Existing Project from previous blog

  1. Navigate to SAP Build Lobby
  2. Locate your existing project (e.g., "Invoice Validation Approval Process Form")
  3. Select the project by clicking on it
  4. Click "Save As" to create a copy
  5. Enter new project details: 
    1. Project Name: Invoice Validation Approval Process Scheduler 
    2. Description: A invoice validation and approval process scheduler
  6. Click "Save" to create the new project   

Step 2: Access and Prepare the Process

  1. Open the newly created project
  2. Navigate to the process section
  3. You should see:
    • Four forms
    • One process
    •  Existing form scheduler (Invoice Validation Approval Process Form)

Phase 2: Removing Existing Process and Adding Scheduled Trigger

Step 3: Remove the Existing Form Process and add the scheduled trigger

  1. Click on the existing form process (Invoice Validation Approval Process Form)
  2. Click "Remove" to delete the form
  3. You'll now see a block asking "How do you want to start your process?"
  4. Click "Add a scheduled trigger

Step 4: Create the Scheduled Trigger

  1. Click on "Scheduled Trigger"
  2. Save the process (mandatory before creating Scheduled trigger)
    • Click the Save button
  3. Configure Scheduled Trigger Details: 
    • Name: Invoice Validation Approval Process Scheduled Trigger 
    • Identifier: [Auto-generated - do not modify]
  4. Click "Create"
  5. You'll see a success message: "Scheduled trigger created successfully"  

Phase 3: Configure the Process Inputs

Step 5: Examine Scheduler Trigger Properties

  1. Click on the Scheduler trigger you just created
  2. Review Output Fields:
  • These are automatically synchronized from process inputs
  • Fields include: Vendor Name, Invoice Number, Invoice Date, Vendor Email, Invoice Amount, Due Date

Phase 4: Project Release and Deployment 

Step 6: Release the Project

  1. Save all changes
  2. Click "Release" button in the top toolbar
  3. Confirm the release when prompted
  4. Wait for successful release message

Click on the "Release" button, add the release notes (Optional) and click on the Release.

Step 7: Deploy the Project

  1. Click "Deploy" button (appears after release)
  2. Select target environment (typically "Public Environment")
  3. Confirm deployment
  4. Wait for deployment completion
  5. Note the deployment success message

Phase 5: Accessing Deployment Information 

Step 8: Navigate to Control Tower

  1. Go to SAP Build Lobby home
  2. Click on "Control Tower"
  3. Navigate to "Tenant Configuration"
  4. Click on "Environments"
  5. Select "Public Environment" (or your deployment target)

Step 9: Locate Your Deployed Project

  1. Find your project: "Invoice Validation Approval Process Scheduled Trigger"
  2. Click on the project name
  3. Navigate to "Triggers" tab
  4. Locate: "Invoice Validation Approval Process Scheduled Trigger"

Phase 6: Configure the Scheduled Trigger

Step 10: Activate the Trigger

  1. Click on the three dots under Actions
  2. Select "Activate"

Step 11: Schedule Configuration

  1. Schedule Tab Settings
    1. Date Range: August 14th, 2025 to August 25th, 2026 (1-month subscription)
    2. Time Zone: IST (Indian Standard Time)
    3. Recurrence: 5 month (monthly execution)
    4. Start Time: 9:43 MM
    5. Day Number: 1st day of every month
  2. Recurrence Options Available
    1. Minutes: Maximum 59 minutes
    2. Hours: Maximum 24 hours
    3. Days: Maximum 7 days
    4. Weeks: Maximum 35 weeks
    5. Months: Maximum 12 months

Step 12: Input Parameters

  1. Configure Input Data
    1. Switch to "Input Parameter" tab
    2. Enter the following sample data:
      1. Vendor Name
      2. Invoice Number
      3. Invoice Date
      4. Vendor Email
      5. Invoice Amount
      6. Due Date
  2. Activate Configuration
    1. Click "Activate"
    2. The trigger will be successfully updated

Phase 7: Testing and Monitoring

Step 13: Test Immediate Execution

  • After activation, you'll see new options under "Actions":
    • Disable trigger
    • Run now (for testing)
    • Edit trigger configuration
  • Click "Run now" for testing

Step 14: Monitor Process Instance

  1. Return to SAP Build Lobby
  2. Navigate to "Monitoring"
  3. Click "Process and Workflow Instances"
  4. Locate your new process instance:
    • Status: Running
    • Instance ID: [Auto-generated]
    • Started by: Scheduled Trigger

Step 15: Review Process Data

  1. Click on the process instance
  2. Review "Process Details":
    • Vendor Name: TEST VENDOR
    • Invoice Number: 1234
    • Invoice Amount: 1000
    • Vendor Email: test-vendor@test.com
    • Due Date: 2024-08-16

    3. Check process flow: Should be waiting for approval

Step 16: Review all the details and Approve the process form

Step 17: Verify Process Completion

  1. Return to "Process and Workflow Instances"
  2. Refresh the page
  3. Check your process instance:
    • Status: Completed
    • All approval messages visible
    • Complete process flow executed 

Conclusion

Scheduled triggers in SAP Build Process Automation offer a robust and flexible way to automate recurring business processes without manual intervention.

Through the vendor invoice validation approval prcess example, we see how such triggers can streamline operations, maintain consistency, and enhance efficiency by executing workflows at precise intervals. By carefully configuring schedules, input parameters, and approval steps, organizations can reduce errors, optimize resources, and scale their automation efforts.

However, success depends on thorough testing, proper security measures, and continuous monitoring to ensure reliability and performance in production environments.

entry.title: Re: Absence Counting Rules 2.0 in Time Management - 2H 2023
entry.content:
Hello @PriyankaAgarwal,

Thanks for the detailed blog addressing all possible scenarios.

I was working on a requirement that you mentioned as sandwich rule, wherein we are required to count the weekly offs when they fall in between the start and end dates of the time off request.

In the the If condition, I checked for the start date and end date falling on the working days using the Day of Week function, then setting the weekly offs to 1. This is working good as of now.

However, if there are many workschedules that have varying weekly offs, probably we need to enhance the rule to include more blocks in the counting rule considering the fact that this is not exposed to lookups. Would this be a good approach? 

Thanks

Pradeep

entry.title: Automation Pilot を使った Cloud Foundry 上のアプリの夜間停止と再起動の構築手順
entry.content:
はじめに

SAP BTPのCloud Foundry環境で稼働するカスタムアプリケーションですが、リソース最適化の観点から夜間は停止させたいというケースも考えられます。そこで、BTP上で提供されるローコード／ノーコードの運用自動化サービスであるAutomation Pilot を活用して、「夜間にアプリを停止し、朝に再起動する」ための構築手順を紹介します。

想定読者は、Cloud FoundryやBTPには馴染みがあるが、Automation Pilotを初めて利用する方となっています。

1. CatalogとInputの作成

最初にCatalogを作成します。

  • Catalog: CommandとInputをまとめるフォルダのような単位で、プロジェクトごとにまとめて管理できます。

今回は 'Sample' という名前を付けます。

 次に、Cloud Foundryアプリを操作するためのInputを作成します。

  • Input: Commandで使う設定値をKey-Value形式でまとめて管理できます。

Input名は 'CfAppOperation' とします。

Inputには、認証情報と対象アプリを特定するための情報を登録します。

  • user : BTPのテクニカルユーザー名
  • password : ユーザーのパスワード (Sensitive設定ON推奨)
  • region : Cloud Foundryリージョン名 (例:  cf-eu10)
  • subAccount : サブアカウント名
  • resourceGroup : スペース名
  • resourceName : アプリケーション名 (例. cap-js-bookshop-srv)

このようにInputとして一度登録しておくと、停止・再起動のCommand実行時に毎回入力する手間が省けます。

2. 停止Command の作成

次に、アプリを停止するためのCommandを作成します。

  • Command: Automation Pilot における実行可能な処理の単位で、開始時にInput Keysを受け取り、Output Keysを返します。Commandは他のCommandを順に組み合わせて構成されます。

作成するCommand名を 'StopCfApp' とし、Catalogとして先ほどの 'Sample' を指定します。

CommandにはExecutorを追加します。

  • Executor: 親Commandの中で利用される「ラッパー」です。対象Commandを正しく実行できるようにInput Keyに値を与える必要があり、その値は直接指定するかDynamic Expressionで参照できます。

事前定義済みの 'applm-sapcp'の'StopCfApp' を選択します。

'StopApplication'で表示されている 'applm-sapcp:StopCfApp:1' をクリックして、情報を見てみます。

InputとOutputのKey-Valueの定義がそれぞれ確認できます。これらの情報をもとに、後述のInput KeysとOutput Keysを設定します。

先ほどのページに戻り、Input Keysを定義します。passwordはSensitive設定ONが推奨です。

最終的に、以下の6つのKeyをInputとして設定します。

'StopApplication'の設定画面で、先ほど作成したInput KeyをDynamic Expressionで紐付けます。

続いて、Output Keysを定義します。

最終的には、このようなOutput Key一覧を定義することになります。

Output Keysも同様に、StopApplicationの出力とDynamic Expressionで紐付けます。

下記のようになります。

3. 動作確認

ここまでで、停止用Commandが完成しました。画面右上の Trigger ボタンから実行し、結果を確認します。

実行結果画面の Output > Show をクリックすると、対象アプリ（例: cap-js-bookshop-srv）が停止されたことが確認できます。エラーが出た場合は、Input設定、権限、値の紐付けなどを再確認してください。

4. スケジュール設定

次に、この停止Commandを自動実行するためにスケジュールを設定します。

StopCfAppを選択します。

ここでは、東京のタイムゾーンで毎日22時に実行するように設定します。

StopCfAppをスケジュールできました。

5. 再起動Commandの設定

朝の稼働時間にアプリを再起動させるため、停止と同様の手順で再起動Commandを設定します。

ここでは事前定義済みの applm-sapcp:RestartCfApp を利用します。停止時と同様にInputを紐付け、スケジュールを「毎日朝7時」などに設定すれば、夜間停止したアプリが自動的に再起動するようになります。

終わりに

本記事では、Automation Pilotを使ってCloud Foundry上のアプリを夜間停止し、朝に再起動させる手順を紹介しました。ポイントは以下の通りです。

  • Inputとして認証情報とアプリ情報を管理
  • 事前定義済みCommand（StopCfApp / RestartCfApp）を利用
  • スケジューリング機能で定期実行

さらに応用として、停止・再起動のメール通知、対象アプリケーションの拡充なども可能です。

日々の運用を効率化する第一歩として、ぜひ試してみてください！

entry.title: Payroll India - Gross Up Tax Calculation
entry.content:
We have a requirement wherein we want to pay employee with "Tax Borne by Company" in advance whenever below components are paid:

  1. Joining Expenses
  2. Log Term Awards
  3. ACE awards
  4. Long Term Momento

We are paying these components using IT0015 and as per the current process we are manually calculating taxes as per the applicable higher tax slab rate and we want to automate this process by writing a PCR wherein it will calculate the applicable tax(as per higher tax slab) and this amount we will pay in advance to employee so that it can be considered as listed components as Taxable amount.

Any relevant documentation will be appreciated or if you can suggest some Payroll Operation to query higher taxable slab rate with respect to each employee.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Planned Inventory active in LS03N, how to clear yello...
entry.content: The report ZLSKZSI01 must be created by note 824904 - Resetting correction report for quant inventory, lqua-skzsi  and is not part of any SP

entry.title: Re: Failed to create a source system based on SAP S/4HANA...
entry.content: Thank you for your reply. The issue was resolved by re-entering and saving the password for the DEVCLNT110 background user in BW, then deleting the DEVCLNT110 Source System, and finally creating it again, which worked successfully.

entry.title: Re: Automatic Batch Creation for Components in Production...
entry.content:
Hi,

You can maintain the automatic batch creation for movement type 531. Which is for goods receipt of by-product. Select he option which start with 'Automatic'.

The configuration path for S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is: IMG -> Logistical - General -> Batch Management -> Creation of New Batches -> Define Batch Creation for Goods Movements.

The SSCUI ID for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is 103517.
